Other Information.Additional Info: Accumulates at the MOF surface due to size sieving effect.
Most water molecules are impeded at the MOF layer; a small fraction passes through.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Facilitated transport via polar ligands and zincophilic metal center

Other Information.Additional Info: Zn2+ shows significantly higher diffusion coefficients compared to SO4^2- and H2O.

Sieving Mechanism: Ion-sieving channels selectively block larger ions and molecules while facilitating Zn2+ transport.

Experimental Validation.Method: Molecular dynamics simulations, electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS), cyclic voltammetry (CV), in situ optical microscopy, scanning electron microscopy (SEM)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Zn2+ diffusion coefficient significantly higher than SO4^2- and H2O; cycling life of 4300 hours at 1 mA cm^-2; average coulombic efficiency of 99.8% over 1400 cycles at 2 mA cm^-2.

Other Information.Additional Info: The Ce–Fe MOF interfacial layer reduces desolvation energy barrier, suppresses hydrogen evolution reaction (HER), and inhibits dendrite formation.
